intro: Kakosmanthus sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
